article.title:
A Severe Fire in Hong Kong
é¦™æ¸¯ç™¼ç”Ÿåš´é‡ç«è­¦

paragraphs.english: On November 26, 2025, a terrible fire broke out in Wang Fuk Yuen, Tai Po, Hong Kong, which shocked the whole city. The fire started from the scaffolding on the outer wall of a building in Wang Fuk Yuen at about 2:51 pm. Within just a few hours, it escalated to a Level 5 fire, the second-highest alarm level in Hong Kong.

implication.english: ğŸ’¡ The Wang Fuk Yuen fire was extremely severe (escalating to Hong Kong's 2nd-highest alarm level quickly), which immediately drew widespread public attention.

paragraphs.english: Strong winds made the fire spread quickly to seven nearby buildings. The old scaffolding and green construction nets on the buildings acted like fuel, making the flames burn more fiercely. The high temperature at the scene was a big challenge for firefighters.

implication.english: ğŸ’¡ Strong winds and flammable building materials (old scaffolding and construction nets) caused the fire to spread rapidly and burn fiercely, posing a great challenge to firefighters due to the high temperature.

paragraphs.english: Some residents were trapped on the upper floors, and rescue workers couldn't reach them immediately due to the extreme heat. However, the rescue team kept in touch with the trapped people by phone to calm them down.

implication.english: ğŸ’¡ Some residents were trapped on the upper floors due to extreme heat that blocked immediate rescue, but the rescue team maintained phone contact with them to ease their anxiety.

paragraphs.english: More than 700 firefighters and rescue workers were sent to the scene, along with 128 fire engines and 57 ambulances. Sadly, the fire caused 13 deaths and 28 injuries, including a 37-year-old firefighter who lost his life while fighting the blaze.

implication.english: ğŸ’¡ A large-scale rescue force was deployed to the fire scene, but the fire still caused heavy casualties, including a 37-year-old firefighter who sacrificed his life while extinguishing the blaze.

paragraphs.english: The Hong Kong Fire Services Department even changed its official website to black and white to mourn the fallen hero. The Hong Kong government took quick action. It opened temporary shelters for the affected residents, and social workers and psychologists were sent to offer emotional support.

implication.english: ğŸ’¡ The Hong Kong Fire Services Department mourned the fallen firefighter by changing its official website to black and white, and the Hong Kong government took prompt measures to provide relief and emotional support to affected residents.

paragraphs.english: Schools near the fire site were closed on November 27 to ensure students' safety. It is important to note that the cause of the fire is still under investigation, but the incident reminds everyone of the importance of safety, especially in old communities under construction.

implication.english: ğŸ’¡ Nearby schools were closed for student safety the day after the fire, the fire's cause remains under investigation, and the incident serves as a reminder of the importance of safety, particularly in old under-construction communities.

readingComprehension.question: 1. What is the main idea of the passage? (Main Idea)

options.text: A. How firefighters trained for fire rescue
B. A severe fire that happened in Hong Kong and its results
C. The importance of fire safety in old communities
D. The Hong Kong government's action on fire prevention

readingComprehension.question: 2. When did the fire break out in Wang Fuk Yuen? (Detail)
3. How many firefighters lost their lives in the fire? (Detail)
4. What does "it" in "It opened temporary shelters" refer to? (Pronoun Reference)

options.text: B. The Hong Kong Fire Services Department

readingComprehension.question: 5. Why were schools near the fire site closed on November 27? (Detail)

options.text: A. Because the students were injured in the fire
B. Because the schools were destroyed by the fire
C. Because to ensure the students' safety
D. Because the teachers were busy with rescue work

readingComprehension.question: 6. What can we infer from the passage? (Inference)

options.text: A. The fire was put out in less than one hour
B. The fire was very difficult to control
C. The cause of the fire has been found out
D. No residents were trapped in the fire

readingComprehension.question: 7. What does "escalated" probably mean? (Word Meaning Guessing)
8. How many ambulances were sent to the fire scene? (Detail)

clozeText: On November 26, 2025, a terrible fire out in Wang Fuk Yuen, Hong Kong. It from the scaffolding of a building and spread due to strong winds. The fire became a Level 5 alarm, which was a big for firefighters. Many residents were trapped, and the team tried their best to help them. They kept in with the trapped people by phone to calm them down. More than 700 workers were to the scene. , a firefighter lost his in the fire. The government took quick to help the affected people, and schools nearby were closed for safety.

sevenFive.text: A Severe Fire in Hong Kong On November 26, 2025, a terrible fire in Wang Fuk Yuen, Tai Po, Hong Kong. The fire started from the scaffolding on the outer wall of a building at about 2:51 pm. , it escalated to a Level 5 fire, which is the second-highest alarm level in Hong Kong. Strong winds played a big role in the fast spread of the fire, as they made the flames to seven nearby buildings. The old scaffolding and green construction nets on the buildings made the fire burn more fiercely. The high temperature at the scene was for firefighters. Some residents were trapped on the upper floors, and rescuers could not reach them at once because of the extreme heat. However, the rescue team did not give up. They with the trapped people by phone to calm them down and told them to stay away from the fire. More than 700 firefighters and rescue workers were sent to the scene, along with many fire engines and ambulances. , the fire caused 13 deaths and 28 injuries, including a 37-year-old firefighter who lost his life while fighting the blaze. The Hong Kong government took quick action to help the affected people. It opened temporary shelters and sent social workers to offer help. Schools near the fire site were closed the next day . The cause of the fire is still under investigation, and it reminds everyone of the importance of fire safety.

options.text: E. Within just a few hours

grammarText: A terrible fire broke out November 26, 2025, in Wang Fuk Yuen, Hong Kong. It started from scaffolding of a building and spread quickly because strong winds. The fire was a big challenge for (firefighter). Many residents (trap) on the upper floors, but the rescue team kept in touch with them by phone. More than 700 workers (send) to the scene. Sadly, a firefighter lost (he) life in the fire. The government took quick action, opened temporary shelters for the affected people. It is important (remember) fire safety. The cause of the fire is still under (investigate).
